en.title: HealthWise AI
en.tagline: тАЬSehat ki sahi jaankari, Swasth jeevan ka sathiтАЭ
health_tips: Drink at least 8 glasses of water daily ЁЯТз
Wash your hands with soap for 20 seconds ЁЯз╝
Take a 30-minute walk every day ЁЯЪ╢тАНтЩВя╕П
Eat fruits and vegetables daily ЁЯНОЁЯеж
Use mosquito nets in dengue season ЁЯжЯ
Wear light clothes during heatwaves тШАя╕П
en.symptoms_description: This tool provides general health information, not a medical diagnosis. Please consult a qualified doctor for medical advice.
en.symptoms_placeholder: e.g., I have a high fever, a persistent cough, and a runny nose...
en.symptoms_error: Please describe your symptoms in at least 10 characters.
en.disclaimer: Disclaimer: This is an AI-generated list and not a substitute for professional medical advice. Please consult a healthcare provider for any health concerns.
en.alerts_description: Stay informed about health advisories and outbreaks in your area.
en.flu_desc: An increase in influenza cases has been reported nationwide. Ensure you are vaccinated.
en.dengue_desc: Mosquito-borne dengue fever cases are on the rise. Eliminate stagnant water sources.
en.measles_desc: A small cluster of measles has been identified. Check vaccination status for children.
en.heatwave_desc: Temperatures are expected to be higher than usual. Stay hydrated and avoid outdoor activities during peak hours.
en.flu_tip: Practice good respiratory hygiene (cover coughs/sneezes), and avoid close contact with sick individuals.
en.dengue_tip: Use mosquito repellents, wear long sleeves, and eliminate stagnant water around your home to reduce mosquito breeding.
en.measles_tip: Ensure children are fully vaccinated with the MMR vaccine and avoid exposure to individuals showing measles symptoms.
en.heatwave_tip: Drink plenty of water, wear light clothing, and stay in the shade during the hottest parts of the day.
en.lifestyle_children_tip2: Play and stay active every day.
en.lifestyle_children_tip3: Wash hands and brush teeth daily.
en.lifestyle_adults_tip2: Eat a balanced diet and drink enough water.
en.preventive_description: Simple steps you can take to protect your health and prevent diseases.
en.preventive_hygiene_content: Wash your hands frequently with soap and water for at least 20 seconds, especially after being in public places, or after blowing your nose, coughing, or sneezing. If soap and water are not readily available, use a hand sanitizer that contains at least 60% alcohol.
en.preventive_hygiene_tip: A simple hand wash can prevent a majority of infections.
en.preventive_diet_content: Eat a balanced diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, and lean proteins. A healthy diet helps boost your immune system and provides the energy you need to stay active and fight off infections.
en.preventive_diet_tip: Eating colorful fruits and vegetables ensures you get a wide range of nutrients.
en.preventive_activity_content: Engage in regular physical activity. Aim for at least 30 minutes of moderate-intensity exercise most days of the week. Exercise can help improve your overall health and well-being, and strengthen your immune system.
en.preventive_activity_tip: Even a brisk 30-minute walk daily can make a huge difference.
en.vaccine_description: A general vaccination schedule. Always consult a doctor for a personalized plan.
en.faq_q1: What should I do if my symptoms are severe?
en.faq_a1: If you are experiencing severe symptoms such as difficulty breathing, chest pain, or loss of consciousness, please seek immediate medical attention by calling your local emergency number or visiting the nearest hospital. This tool is for informational purposes only and not a substitute for professional medical advice.
en.faq_q2: How accurate is the symptom checker?
en.faq_a2: The symptom checker is an AI-powered tool designed to provide potential health concerns based on the symptoms you provide. It is not a diagnostic tool and should not be used as a substitute for a consultation with a qualified healthcare professional. The accuracy depends on the information you provide and the underlying data.
en.faq_a3: We take your privacy seriously. The information you provide is used to give you health information and is not shared with third parties without your consent. Please review our privacy policy for more details.
en.contact_title: Get Health Info on the Go
en.contact_description: Access HealthWise AI through your favorite messaging apps.
en.emergency_description: In case of a medical emergency, use these numbers.
